subject: Programming
title: Hash Tables
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hash Tables usable.

hook.text: Give me a key, I'll give you the value â€” instantly. Hash tables are the speed kings of data structures.

buildup.text: A hash function converts a key into an array index. Jump directly to the right slot, no searching.

discovery.text: Average lookup, insert, and delete all take O(1) â€” constant time regardless of the table size.

twist.text: Two different keys can hash to the same slot. These collisions must be resolved or performance drops.

climax.text: Dictionaries in Python, objects in JavaScript, and maps in Java are all hash tables underneath.

punchline.text: The right key opens the right door instantly.

quiz.question: What is a hash collision?
options: Two keys mapping to the same array slot
A hash table running out of memory
A key that cannot be hashed
